name: market for corrugated board box | corrugated board box | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18379/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'corrugated board box', in the geography of Canada, Québec.;Corrugated board boxes are commonly not traded globally but rather on regional/local markets. This datasets therefore represents the market for such boxes in Quebec. Transport distances and modes were estimated. Losses are assumed negligible for this type of product.;Containerboard is the umbrella term for two different types of board, linerboard and fluting medium, which are both required to produce corrugated board. Linerboard is a flat layer of board, which can be further distinguished in kraftliner and testliner, depending on whether it is of virgin or recycled origin, respectively. Fluting medium is the corrugated middle layer between a top and bottom layer of linerboard. Together all three layers constitute corrugated board. Virgin fluting medium is commonly called semichemical fluting, while recycled fluting can also be called wellenstoff.;

The activity starts at the gate of the corrugated box board factory.

The activity ends at the gate of the using entity.
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1702:Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard and of containers of paper a

exchanges.description: Estimated value, assuming average European transport distances as a proxy for Quebec. European distance derived as follows: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for road freight transport. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf 'Road transport > Road freight transport measurement > Total road freight transport > Road freight transport by type of goods and type of transport (t, tkm) - annual data (ROAD_GO_TA_TG)' (https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/databrowser/) on 2023-08-02. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported (t) and total payload-distance (t*km) for the NST 2007 category 'GT06 - Wood and products of wood and cork (except furniture); articles of straw and plaiting materials; pulp, paper and paper products; printed matter and recorded media' in the year 2016 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of road transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 209 km. The fraction of goods transported by road (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 91% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by road in 2016 was 191 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.

exchanges.description: Estimated value, assuming average European transport distances as a proxy for Quebec. European distance derived as follows: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for inland waterways transport of goods. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf 'Inland waterways transport > Inland waterways transport measurement - goods > Inland waterways transport measurement - goods - annual data > Transport by type of good (from 2007 onwards with NST2007) (IWW_GO_ATYGO)' (https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/databrowser/) on the 2023-08-02. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported (t) and total payload-distance (t*km) for the NST 2007 category 'GT06 - Wood and products of wood and cork (except furniture); articles of straw and plaiting materials; pulp, paper and paper products; printed matter and recorded media' in the year 2016 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of inland waterways transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 385 km. The fraction of goods transported by rail (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 0.7% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by inland waterways in 2016 was 2.5 km. The value is assumed to be representative for Europe.

exchanges.description: Estimated value, assuming average European transport distances as a proxy for Quebec. European distance derived as follows: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for railway transport of goods. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf 'Railway transport > Railway transport measurement - goods > Goods transported by group of goods - from 2008 onwards based on NST 2007 (RAIL_GO_GRPGOOD)' (https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/databrowser/) on the 2023-08-02. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported (t) and total payload-distance (t*km) for the NST 2007 category 'GT06 - Wood and products of wood and cork (except furniture); articles of straw and plaiting materials; pulp, paper and paper products; printed matter and recorded media' in the year 2016 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of railway transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 318 km. The fraction of goods transported by rail (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 8.2% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by rail in 2016 was 26 km. The value is assumed to be representative for Europe.
